Multi Lock

Introduction

MultiLock is an interface providing central locking capabilities that can be shared across a whole application. This interface is especially useful when you need to synchronize objects and cannot modify their code. By instantiating one of this interface's implementation and making it accessible through the ServletContext or Spring's ApplicationContext or even through an application EJB, any component can acquire and release locks attached to specific instances of a class.

Example

Here is an example of how you can use a MultiLock to protect against concurrent modifications of instances in other parts of the application.

//Retrive MultiLock from context
MultiLock<Integer> multiLock = acquireMultiLock();

//Acquire locks
multiLock.lock(1);
multiLock.lock(2);
multiLock.lock(3);

//Here do operations on instances of some entity object
//that have 1,2 and 3
//as id and may be concurrent to other operations on these instances

//Release locks
multiLock.unLock(3);
multiLock.unLock(2);
multiLock.unLock(1);
